alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Florence and central Darlington Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms in a cluster extending from 7 miles southwest of Bishopville to near Sardis. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Hartsville, Darlington, Timmonsville, Lamar, Quinby, Mars Bluff, Lydia, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek, Cartersville, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Oats, New Hope, Sardis, Effingham, Auburn, Francis Marion University, Claussen and Olanta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 126 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 146 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
